solution_line_template: Tony and Dean together read {tony_books} + {dean_books} = <<{tony_books}+{dean_books}={tony_dean_sum}>>{tony_dean_sum} books

{tony_dean_duplicates} of these books were duplicates so Tony and Dean together read {tony_dean_sum} - {tony_dean_duplicates} = <<{tony_dean_sum}-{tony_dean_duplicates}={tony_dean_unique}>>{tony_dean_unique} unique books

Because the books are being counted three times, the book is counted {num_readers_common_book} - {desired_count} = <<{num_readers_common_book}-{desired_count}={extra_count_common_to_all}>>{extra_count_common_to_all} extra times.
All together they have read {all_three_sum} - {extra_count_common_to_all} = <<{all_three_sum}-{extra_count_common_to_all}={total_unique_books}>>{total_unique_books} different books
